For other types that are not arrays, returns an instance of .
For single-dimensional arrays returns where the generic type is the primitive type or .
For jagged and multi-dimensional arrays, returns an instance of .

member.returns: if it starts with NRBF payload header; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.Formats.Nrbf.NrbfDecoder.StartsWithPayloadHeader(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Checks if given stream starts with NRBF payload header.
member.param: The stream to inspect. The stream must be both readable and seekable.
member.returns: if it starts with NRBF payload header; otherwise, .
member.exception: The stream does not support reading or seeking.

remarks.para: When this method returns, will be restored to its original position.

member.name: M:System.Formats.Nrbf.NrbfDecoder.Decode(System.IO.Stream,System.Formats.Nrbf.PayloadOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decodes the provided NRBF payload.
member.param: The NRBF payload.
Options to control behavior during parsing.
to leave payload open after the reading is finished; otherwise, .
member.returns: A that represents the root object. It can be either , a or an .
member.exception: does not support reading or is already closed.
Reading from encounters invalid NRBF data.
Reading from encounters not supported records. For example, arrays with non-zero offset or not supported record types (, , or ).
Reading from encounters an invalid UTF8 sequence.
The end of the stream is reached before reading record.

to leave payload open after the reading is finished; otherwise, .

member.name: M:System.Formats.Nrbf.NrbfDecoder.PushFirstNestedRecordInfo(System.Formats.Nrbf.SerializationRecord,System.Collections.Generic.Stack{System.Formats.Nrbf.NextInfo})
member.summary: This method is responsible for pushing only the FIRST read info of the NESTED record into the . It's not pushing all of them, because it could be used as a vector of attack. Example: BinaryArrayRecord with Array.MaxLength length, where first item turns out to be that provides Array.MaxLength nulls.

member.name: P:System.Formats.Nrbf.PayloadOptions.UndoTruncatedTypeNames
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether type name truncation is undone.
member.value: if truncated type names should be reassembled; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Example: TypeName: "Namespace.TypeName`1[[Namespace.GenericArgName" LibraryName: "AssemblyName]]" Is combined into "Namespace.TypeName`1[[Namespace.GenericArgName, AssemblyName]]"
Setting this to can render susceptible to Denial of Service attacks when parsing or handling malicious input.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that an API is experimental and it may change in the future.
member.remarks: This attribute allows call sites to be flagged with a diagnostic that indicates that an experimental feature is used. Authors can use this attribute to ship preview features in their assemblies.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.param: The ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.DiagnosticId
member.summary: Gets the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.remarks:
The diagnostic ID is shown in build output for warnings and errors.
This property represents the unique ID that can be used to suppress the warnings or errors, if needed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.UrlFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for corresponding documentation. The API accepts a format string instead of an actual URL, creating a generic URL that includes the diagnostic ID.
member.value: The format string that represents a URL to corresponding documentation.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method requires the ability to generate new code at runtime, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when compiling ahead of time.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires dynamic code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it. Specifies that an input argument was not null when the call returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.

member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.

member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to indicate a source generator should create a function for marshalling arguments instead of relying on the runtime to generate an equivalent marshalling function at run-time.
member.remarks: This attribute is meaningless if the source generator associated with it is not enabled. The current built-in source generator only supports C# and only supplies an implementation when applied to static, partial, non-generic methods.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .
member.param: Name of the library containing the import.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.LibraryName
member.summary: Gets the name of the library containing the import.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.EntryPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the entry point to be called.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.StringMarshalling
member.summary: Gets or sets how to marshal string arguments to the method.
member.remarks: If this field is set to a value other than , must not be specified.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.StringMarshallingCustomType
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to control how string arguments to the method are marshalled.
member.remarks: If this field is specified, must not be specified or must be set to .

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.SetLastError
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the callee sets an error (SetLastError on Windows or errno on other platforms) before returning from the attributed method.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling
member.summary: Specifies how strings should be marshalled for generated p/invokes

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Custom
member.summary: Indicates the user is supplying a specific marshaller in .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Utf8
member.summary: Use the platform-provided UTF-8 marshaller.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Utf16
member.summary: Use the platform-provided UTF-16 marshaller.
